cyclone.name: BONNIE
cyclone.current_location: about 130 miles SSE of Charleston, South Carolina
cyclone.trajectory: Forecast to drift NNW toward the central South Carolina coast near Charleston on Sunday, then slow NE along the South and North Carolina coastline through mid-week.
cyclone.expected_landfall_location: near the central South Carolina coast just north of the Savannah River, in the vicinity of Charleston

weather_observation.warning_coast: Savannah River to Little River Inlet South Carolina
weather_observation.impacted_coast: Entire central and northern South Carolina coast and eventually southeastern North Carolina
weather_observation.wind: Tropical-storm-force winds up to 45 mph possible in and near the port beginning overnight Saturday into Sunday.
weather_observation.storm_surge: 1–2 ft inundation above ground level possible at high tide Sunday morning.
weather_observation.rainfall: Widespread 2–4 inches with localized amounts to 6 inches; flash-flooding in low-lying terminal areas possible.
weather_observation.other_hazards: Dangerous surf and rip currents; isolated tornadoes near the coast during the early stages of landfall.
